TopicTitle: [WIP] [1.0.5] (Dev Paused) QuizTech Aero Pack v1.2.9.x | Updated: 8/9/15 |

Articles.Content:
> 
> a singe f-22 nozzles? what would we do with it? an ASF-1 Shinden? (ace combat plane)

It would be like this engine from B9 aerospace, but a stock-a-like version. The way that this engine is modeled allows things to be attached to the sides, and it looks like one unit when they are put on a bicoupler.

Not yet, been busy irl lol, but I'm going to keep working on the helicopter parts for now as they are first on my list ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
oh okay
how are the parts going? ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

That's actually the one from B9 Aerospace. Quiznos was showing it as an example

B9 Maintenance port download

[https://bitbucket.org/blowfishpro/b9-aerospace](https://bitbucket.org/blowfishpro/b9-aerospace)

Hey, is it possible to get the cockpits packaged on their own? These things are amazing (works great in FAR, by the by), but I have no real use for the rest of the parts and would like to have other people be able to use my planes without having to load everything else in the mod.

If you don't want to go through the effort, I'd be happy to root through and pare it down. However, I'd like to ask for your permission to distribute the cockpits on their own so others can use my planes without part load (with credit to you, of course).

> 
> Hey, is it possible to get the cockpits packaged on their own? These things are amazing (works great in FAR, by the by), but I have no real use for the rest of the parts and would like to have other people be able to use my planes without having to load everything else in the mod.
> If you don't want to go through the effort, I'd be happy to root through and pare it down. However, I'd like to ask for your permission to distribute the cockpits on their own so others can use my planes without part load (with credit to you, of course).

It's very easy to delete things on your own, since it's all organized into folders. Just delete the ones you don't want.

> 
> It's very easy to delete things on your own, since it's all organized into folders. Just delete the ones you don't want.

I acknowledged my willingness to do this in my post. The request was primarily to facilitate the ease of distributing my planes. Also, many of the assets in this pack (according to the warning on the readme) are interwoven, so I'll have to check through each part I want to keep to see what is used where.

> 
> I acknowledged my willingness to do this in my post. The request was primarily to facilitate the ease of distributing my planes. Also, many of the assets in this pack (according to the warning on the readme) are interwoven, so I'll have to check through each part I want to keep to see what is used where.

I can look into making them a separate download, since I know that it is true that one of the major draws to the pack seems to be the cockpits. I don't believe that they rely on any other parts since they are all completely custom to each other (no textures shared or whatnot). After I finish the helicopter parts, which I hope to work on again soon, I can see about it.
Thanks for looking into it. I've been having a lot of fun with these parts.

Progress continues:

Hey,

just wanted to ask whether VTOL parts without pre-attached engines are still on the todo list?

> 
> Hey,
> just wanted to ask whether VTOL parts without pre-attached engines are still on the todo list?

Yep it's still on the list, although it's been put near the bottom for the moment. I haven't ruled them out, I'm just having more fun working on the helicopter parts right now ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
why isnt the cockpit on the same profile of the rest? ![:sticktongue:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue2.gif)

> 
> why isnt the cockpit on the same profile of the rest? ![:sticktongue:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue2.gif)

Well it looks nice and round (2.5m at a guess?) so maybe its so we don't strictly have to use Quiztech Aero bits to make big fancy helicopters.
it doesnt look good ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)
My only thing is that I think the cockpit looks too....long......possibly cut off the first part, before the windows?

> 
> Well it looks nice and round (2.5m at a guess?) so maybe its so we don't strictly have to use Quiztech Aero bits to make big fancy helicopters.

Yeah that's what I was going for. I didn't want to limit it to use with only that part profile...but I can consider changing it if folks would like that better.

> 
> My only thing is that I think the cockpit looks too....long......possibly cut off the first part, before the windows?

Yep I shortened it today and I think it looks a lot better ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) I still have to buff out a section that bulges out a bit (circled), but otherwise it's almost ready to be textured. You may notice the other part I've been working on lol. I plan to make two mounts, one taller and one shorter, to attach them to ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

At last, more helicopter parts!

Will the rotor base attach blades, and thus use in-game physics to generate lift and change collective (harder to do, but much more fun!), or produce a thrust vector, like other present rotors do?
